io.robusta.rra.security

Interface Codec

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CodecImpl

    public interface Codec
    Common interface for usual work in username/password encoding through the web
    Author:
    robusta web

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String decodeBase64(java.lang.String encoded)
      Decode a Base64 string
      java.lang.String encodeBase64(java.lang.String toEncode)
      Encode a Base64 string.
      java.lang.String encodeMD5(java.lang.String toHash)
      Create a MD5 hash.
      java.lang.String getPassword(java.lang.String b64String)
      Returns the password side of the B64 encoded String, when the B64 string is encoded like : "user:password"
      java.lang.String getUsername(java.lang.String b64String)
      Returns the username side of the B64 encoded String, when the B64 string is encoded like : "user:password"

    • Method Detail

      • encodeBase64

        java.lang.String encodeBase64(java.lang.String toEncode)
        Encode a Base64 string. Usually, the string to encode looks is "user:password" For newbbes, please note that Base64 does not encrypt but allows to submit for exemple a password containint spaces or special caracters through the web
        Parameters:
        toEncode - String to encode
        Returns:
        a Base64 encoded string
        See Also:
        encodeBase64(String)

      • decodeBase64

        java.lang.String decodeBase64(java.lang.String encoded)
        Decode a Base64 string
        Parameters:
        encoded - String to encode
        Returns:
        a Base64 encoded string
        See Also:
        decodeBase64(String)

      • encodeMD5

        java.lang.String encodeMD5(java.lang.String toHash)
        Create a MD5 hash. Be aware that MD5 alone is not a truly safe method to protect your users password. See for exemple John the Ripper software.
        Parameters:
        toHash - String to hash
        Returns:
        the hash

      • getUsername

        java.lang.String getUsername(java.lang.String b64String)
                             throws CodecException
        Returns the username side of the B64 encoded String, when the B64 string is encoded like : "user:password"
        Parameters:
        b64String -
        Returns:
        the username
        Throws:
        CodecException - if no username can be found in the enocoded string
        See Also:
        encodeBase64(String)

      • getPassword

        java.lang.String getPassword(java.lang.String b64String)
                             throws CodecException
        Returns the password side of the B64 encoded String, when the B64 string is encoded like : "user:password"
        Parameters:
        b64String -
        Returns:
        the password
        Throws:
        CodecException - if no password can be found in the enocoded string
        See Also:
        encodeBase64(String)
